title: It's been mentioned so many times already; this is an unacceptable visual bug.
body: Why is it that 3 weeks after the new Rift comes out that we are still seeing the visual bug where **moving your camera over a teammate or opponent makes it seem as if they took damage at that moment**, when it is really all the damage that they accumulated since you last saw them? There have been numerous threads already but it just doesn't seem to garner any attention at all. It is incredibly misleading and without a doubt should be your top priority of known and readily fixable bugs.

> How do you know it will be miniscule? a minor glitch in code can be a huge time consuming fix.

I don't know the scale but in the end my complaint is from a player experience perspective, which Riot claims is their primary objective that they work around. Tower defense may be lackluster at the moment but it doesn't really detract from my immediate interactions in the game. I may lose because my nexus towers are squishy as hell but I wouldn't blame them solely because there were certainly mistakes that led to the point where my nexus is being threatened to begin with.
However, this bug and potential consequences in teamfights lead to more immediate outcomes and I can directly feel its impact after it has occurred. I don't know how to properly explain this but when you have more control over a situation, it is more frustrating to have a bug occur as opposed to when everything is already out of your control (i.e. enemy has 20k gold lead and is pushing in on your nexus).
HOLY SH*T HOW DID XIN ZHAO JUST TAKE ALL OF HIS HEALTH AT ONCE- oh wait, nevermind, visual bugs.
And then you stop and think for a minute, and it turns out, it isnt a bug.

How is this not a bug? If there is an animation of the health bar dropping, that should imply to you that someone has taken a certain amount of damage at that instant and precisely at that instant. If I were to use Veigar's ult on someone for half their health, I want to see this animation right in front of me. Conversely, I don't want to see someone's health bar drop for an equal amount instantaneously when I pan my camera over them as a consequence of autoattack trading that they may have done over a period of 3 minutes. This bug may key off to me that a teammate has used an ability such as Veigar's ultimate while in reality they may still have it, or mislead me to think that my teammates have already hard committed to taking out a target. There is no reason that this should be in the game.

It's not a bug, it's a feature.  It makes it very easy to see as a glance how things have changed since you last checked in.  I've found it especially helpful as jungler because it helps when I'm running in to gank a lane and want to be able to see in an instant how the lane is doing.
For me it only makes me scared of the enemy burst. We can check the lane just by looking at the ally health, no need of it showing how much went missing from their full health.
